document.docTitle: Pselaphodes tibialis Yin & Li, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Notes on Michael Schuelke's pselaphine collections from China. - Tyrini. I. genera Labomimus Sharp, Linan Hlavac and Pselaphodes Westwood (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Pselaphinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on Michael Schuelke's pselaphine collections from China. - Tyrini. I. genera Labomimus Sharp, Linan Hlavac and Pselaphodes Westwood (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Pselaphinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Pselaphodes tibialis Yin & Li sp. n. Figs 15B17

(2 ♂♂). Holotype: ♂, labeled 'CHINA: Yunnan [CH07-09], / Dali Bai Aut. Pref., Diancang Shan 45 / km NW Dali, 2730 m, 26°01'20"N , 99°53'17"E , creek valley, pines, ferns, / sifted, 29.V.2007, M. Schuelke' (cSch). Paratype: 1 ♂, same label data as holotype (cSch).

Reddish brown; length 2.52-2.58; postgenae slightly angulate posterolaterally; antennomeres IX-XI enlarged, IX modified in the male; pronotum with lateral margins slightly angularly expanded laterally; with metaventral processes apically enlarged; metacoxae simple; aedeagus with asymmetric median lobe.

The resemblance in general habitus, antennal modification, placement of spines on the legs, and the shared modified pro- and mesotibiae place Pselaphodes tibialis closest to Pselaphodes venustus sp. n. described below. The two species can be separated by the smaller body size, the metaventral process being much thinner, and different aedeagal form in Pselaphodes tibialis , while Pselaphodes venustus is larger in size (3.07-3.34) and the metaventral process are much stouter.
Individuals were sifted from mixed leaf litter in a ravine.
The specific name refers to the modifications present on the pro- and mesotibiae .

caption.paragraph: Figure 17. Diagnostic features of Pselaphodes tibialis . A antenna B pronotum C median meteventral process, in lateral view D procoxa, protrochanter and profemur E apical portion of protibia F mesotrochanter and mesofemur G apical portion of mesotibia H metatrochanter and metafemur I sternite IX J aedeagus, in dorsal view K same, in lateral view L same, in ventral view. Scales (mm): A, B, C, D, F, H, J, K, L = 0.2; I = 0.1; E, G = 0.05.
